intro: Pleurothallis escobarii, commonly known as the Escobar's pleurothallis, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to the cloud forests of Central America. It is a small, terrestrial orchid with delicate, strap-shaped leaves and produces fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its blooming period typically occurs during the wet season, adding to its ecological significance in its native habitat. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in the wild.
